nodes.body: Thanks for the review, I have made the changes as requested.
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by Ruben-VandeVelde.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8153266886/job/22284300919)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8153266886/job/22284300225)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8153266886/job/22284301128)
I think that you only need `E` to be normed for `norm_fst` and only `F` to be normed for `norm_snd`. Also, you don't need `G` at all.
Presumably it's sufficient for `E` to have some element of non-trivial norm? @urkud, do we have a typeclass for this?

I'm pretty sure no such typeclass exists, since I copied the setup from `ContinuousLinearMap.norm_id_le` / `norm_id` which is probably the most obvious place such a typeclass would be used if it existed.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(OperatorNorm/Prod): norm of first/second projection
